University of Aberdeen is in the top 200 universities of the world. Where is pera and japura again ? lol what a joke. These doctors are afraid of loosing their control and unions are afraid of loosing their students.

To be a top ranking university, there are certain conditions like number of students and faculties etc... Does any university in Sri Lanka can accommodate around 50000 students like those top ranking univerties? It is unclear how they measure the quality of education when ranking universities... Nevertheless stupid Sri Lankans should understand that it is the responsibility of the government to uplift the conditions of local universities to meet those so called top ranking standards... And people like you should vote for proper people in order to achieve that goal...

It's not just the number of students, factors like the research output of the university , student to staff ratio and especially the quality of teaching and employability of graduates after their degree, all contribute to the university rankings. Why is it always the responsibility of the government? The government is already giving free healthcare, subsidized power, water and transportation among other things. Sri Lanka is not a rich country to give free education and then also increase facilities in universities. Therefore when we get the chance to partner with a world renowned university and if it's beneficial to Sri Lanka, we need to take the opportunity. And local uni students spend more time protesting on the street than actually doing their studies, if the uni students were told to at least pay half their fees it would be fun to see their reactions. There are undergraduates in unionized unis that have been doing their bachelors degrees for the past 7 years, I am not willing to pay for the education of people like that.

Twin programs can not be accepted. We should improve our local universities.There is no need to establish and private universities at present. Medical faculty should not be a commercial item. You can see the status of India regarding medical faculties which mainly consists of private medical facilities.
Oh go suck it jealous idiot.
Can understand how you got the Doc title. Yes there is a minimum number. But it is not 50k as you say.

Those who want to do Medicine in England do it in Malaysia IMU. First 2.5 years in Malaysia and rest in a partner university in the UK , Australia or Canada. You need to have good AL results and must have done chemistry and Biology at AL. The Malaysia part is extremely hard and there are drop outs. UK has relaxed the visa conditions and after your degree you can now work for 2 years for your internship. You are graduated from a UK university and will be able to work anywhere in the world except Sri Lanka as the quality of medical education is higher than the rest of the world. The total cost including living expenses is expensive approximately 48 million (IMU - 18 mill + UK 30 mill) Since the students are now allowed to work for 2 years, you can earn part of the cost, may be 15 million. What is suggested by Asiri and Aberdeen may be the same.

Problem in private medical education in SL is the substandard entry criteria, not the training.. Even they enroll 2s-3s in A/L..In standard private medical facilities should enroll students with good results. Medicine is a subject where we have to take urgent bed side decisions in very stressful situations where we need intelegence and memory recall the most.I am reluctant to say but I would say nearly 70% of SITEM graduates are substanded. At the moment Frist batch of SITEM graduates are working as interns,they are nice people but knowledge and skills are near zero. I don't tell all state sector students are good but majority are at good standard, their main issue is attitude .
